item.title: [Python] About package management with conda and pip
item.description: [Anaconda](https://www.anaconda.com/) is, in a word, a library of scientific computations etc. attached from the beginning in addition to Python itself. In addition, it has been devised to simplify package management and deployment, and comes with a package management command called conda. About conda and pip The Python world has been around for quite some time with its own package management tools, which used to be EasyInstall, and later to use pip.

item.title: [Python] How to install Deep Learning Framework Tensorflow 1.0 on Windows Anaconda environment
item.description: #Introduction Until now, we have been doing deep learning by running Tensorflow on the back end of Keras. If you just do machine learning in Python, you can use Keras as before, but there are applications where you want to use models and weights learned in Python in C++. Actually, it would be nice to use a model trained with Keras, but it seems easier to code directly with Tensorflow which also has a C++ API, so I will try to attack from there.
